line_1: THESE, the last lines my trembling hands can write,
line_2: These words, the last my dying lips recite,

line_1: These words, the last my dying lips recite,
line_2: THESE, the last lines my trembling hands can write,

line_1: Read, and repent that your unkindness gave
line_2: A wretched lover an untimely grave!

line_1: A wretched lover an untimely grave!
line_2: Read, and repent that your unkindness gave

line_1: Sunk by despair from life's enchanting view,
line_2: Lost, ever lost to happiness and you! —

line_1: Lost, ever lost to happiness and you! —
line_2: Sunk by despair from life's enchanting view,

line_1: No more these eye-lids shower incessant tears,
line_2: No more my spirit sinks with boding fears;

line_1: No more my spirit sinks with boding fears;
line_2: No more these eye-lids shower incessant tears,

line_1: No more your frowns my suing passion meet,
line_2: No more I fall submissive at your feet:

line_1: No more I fall submissive at your feet:
line_2: No more your frowns my suing passion meet,

line_1: With fruitless love this heart shall cease to burn,
line_2: Life's empty dream shall never-more return.

line_1: Life's empty dream shall never-more return.
line_2: With fruitless love this heart shall cease to burn,

line_1: Think not, that labouring to subdue your hate;
line_2: My artful soul forebodes a fancied fate;

line_1: My artful soul forebodes a fancied fate;
line_2: Think not, that labouring to subdue your hate;

line_1: For e'er yon sun descends his western way,
line_2: Cold shall I lie, a lifeless lump of clay!

line_1: Cold shall I lie, a lifeless lump of clay!
line_2: For e'er yon sun descends his western way,

line_1: Tir'd of my long encounters with disdain,
line_2: Peaceful my pulse, and ebbing from its pain;

line_1: Peaceful my pulse, and ebbing from its pain;
line_2: Tir'd of my long encounters with disdain,

line_1: Each vital movement sinking to decay,
line_2: And my spent soul just languishing away;

line_1: And my spent soul just languishing away;
line_2: Each vital movement sinking to decay,

line_1: E'er my last breath yet hovers to depart,
line_2: I prompt my hand to pour out all my heart.

line_1: I prompt my hand to pour out all my heart.
line_2: E'er my last breath yet hovers to depart,

line_1: The hand, oft rais'd compassion to implore;
line_2: The heart, that burns with slighted fires no more!

line_1: The heart, that burns with slighted fires no more!
line_2: The hand, oft rais'd compassion to implore;

line_1: Relentless nymph! of nature's fairest frame,
line_2: Unpitying soul, and woman but in name;

line_1: Unpitying soul, and woman but in name;
line_2: Relentless nymph! of nature's fairest frame,

line_1: Angelic bloom the coldest heart to win,
line_2: Without, allurement, but disdain within;

line_1: Without, allurement, but disdain within;
line_2: Angelic bloom the coldest heart to win,

line_1: Regard the sounds which seal my parting breath
line_2: E'er the vain murmurs shall be hush'd in death,

line_1: E'er the vain murmurs shall be hush'd in death,
line_2: Regard the sounds which seal my parting breath

line_1: Let pity view what love disdain'd to save,
line_2: And mourn a wretch sent headlong to the grave.

line_1: And mourn a wretch sent headlong to the grave.
line_2: Let pity view what love disdain'd to save,

line_1: Profuse of all an anxious lover's care,
line_2: To urge his suit, and win the listening fair;

line_1: To urge his suit, and win the listening fair;
line_2: Profuse of all an anxious lover's care,

line_1: Try'd every purpose to relieve my woe,
line_2: My soul chides not, for innocent I go;

line_1: My soul chides not, for innocent I go;
line_2: Try'd every purpose to relieve my woe,

line_1: Save when soft pity bids my gentler mind
line_2: Shrink at your fate, and drop a tear behind.

line_1: Shrink at your fate, and drop a tear behind.
line_2: Save when soft pity bids my gentler mind

line_1: How oft and fruitless have I strove to move
line_2: Unfeeling beauty with the pangs of love;

line_1: Unfeeling beauty with the pangs of love;
line_2: How oft and fruitless have I strove to move

line_1: As rose your breast with captivating grace,
line_2: And heighten'd charms flew blushing to your face;

line_1: And heighten'd charms flew blushing to your face;
line_2: As rose your breast with captivating grace,

line_1: Insulting charms! that gave a fiercer wound,
line_2: Fond as I lay, and prostrate on the ground.

line_1: Fond as I lay, and prostrate on the ground.
line_2: Insulting charms! that gave a fiercer wound,

line_1: Heavens! with what scorn you strove my suit to meet,
line_2: Frown'd with your eyes, and spurn'd me with your feet!

line_1: Frown'd with your eyes, and spurn'd me with your feet!
line_2: Heavens! with what scorn you strove my suit to meet,

line_1: To bleeding love such hard returns you gave,
line_2: As barbarous rocks that dash the pressing wave.

line_1: As barbarous rocks that dash the pressing wave.
line_2: To bleeding love such hard returns you gave,

line_1: O could your looks have turn'd my hapless fate,
line_2: And frown'd my short-liv'd passion into hate;

line_1: And frown'd my short-liv'd passion into hate;
line_2: O could your looks have turn'd my hapless fate,

line_1: Then had no scattering breeze my sorrows known,
line_2: Nor vale responsive had prolong'd the moan;

line_1: Nor vale responsive had prolong'd the moan;
line_2: Then had no scattering breeze my sorrows known,

line_1: Then had those lips ne'er learnt their woeful tale,
line_2: Nor death yet cloath'd them in eternal pale.

line_1: Nor death yet cloath'd them in eternal pale.
line_2: Then had those lips ne'er learnt their woeful tale,

line_1: Oft to the woods in frantic rage I slew
line_2: To cool my bosom with the falling dew;

line_1: To cool my bosom with the falling dew;
line_2: Oft to the woods in frantic rage I slew

line_1: Oft in sad accents sigh'd each prompting ill,
line_2: And taught wild oaks to pity and to feel;

line_1: And taught wild oaks to pity and to feel;
line_2: Oft in sad accents sigh'd each prompting ill,

line_1: Till with despair my heart rekindled burns,
line_2: And all the anguish of my soul returns.

line_1: And all the anguish of my soul returns.
line_2: Till with despair my heart rekindled burns,

line_1: Then restless to the fragrant meads I hie,
line_2: Death in my face, distraction in my eye;

line_1: Death in my face, distraction in my eye;
line_2: Then restless to the fragrant meads I hie,

line_1: There as reclin'd along the verdant plain,
line_2: My grief renews her heart-wrung strains again,

line_1: My grief renews her heart-wrung strains again,
line_2: There as reclin'd along the verdant plain,

line_1: Lo! pitying Phoebus sinks, with sorrow pale,
line_2: And mournful night descends upon the tale!

line_1: And mournful night descends upon the tale!
line_2: Lo! pitying Phoebus sinks, with sorrow pale,

line_1: When tir'd, at length, my wrongs no more complain,
line_2: And sighs are stifled in obtuser pain;

line_1: And sighs are stifled in obtuser pain;
line_2: When tir'd, at length, my wrongs no more complain,

line_1: When the deep fountains of my eyes are spent,
line_2: And fiercer anguish sinks to discontent;

line_1: And fiercer anguish sinks to discontent;
line_2: When the deep fountains of my eyes are spent,

line_1: Slow I return, and prostrate on my bed
line_2: Bid the soft pillow lull my heavy head.

line_1: Bid the soft pillow lull my heavy head.
line_2: Slow I return, and prostrate on my bed

line_1: But O! when downy sleep its court renews,
line_2: And shades the soul with visionary views,

line_1: And shades the soul with visionary views,
line_2: But O! when downy sleep its court renews,

line_1: Illusive dreams to fan my slumbering fire,
line_2: And wake the fever of intense desire,

line_1: And wake the fever of intense desire,
line_2: Illusive dreams to fan my slumbering fire,

line_1: Present your softer image to my sight,
line_2: All warm with smiles, and glowing with delight;

line_1: All warm with smiles, and glowing with delight;
line_2: Present your softer image to my sight,

line_1: Gods! with what bliss I view thy darling charms,
line_2: And strive to clasp thee melting in my arms! —

line_1: And strive to clasp thee melting in my arms! —
line_2: Gods! with what bliss I view thy darling charms,

line_1: But ah! the shade my empty grasp deceives;
line_2: And as it flits, and my fond soul bereaves,

line_1: And as it flits, and my fond soul bereaves,
line_2: But ah! the shade my empty grasp deceives;

line_1: The transient slumbers slip their airy chain,
line_2: And give me back to all my woes again:

line_1: And give me back to all my woes again:
line_2: The transient slumbers slip their airy chain,

line_1: There wrapt in floods of grief I sigh forlorn,
line_2: The constant greetings of unwelcome morn.

line_1: The constant greetings of unwelcome morn.
line_2: There wrapt in floods of grief I sigh forlorn,

line_1: But should oblivion reassume her sway,
line_2: And slumbers once more steal my woes away;

line_1: And slumbers once more steal my woes away;
line_2: But should oblivion reassume her sway,

line_1: When the short flights of fancy intervene,
line_2: Your much-lov'd image fills out every scene.

line_1: Your much-lov'd image fills out every scene.
line_2: When the short flights of fancy intervene,

line_1: But now no more soft smiles your face adorn,
line_2: Lo! o'er each feature broods destructive scorn.

line_1: Lo! o'er each feature broods destructive scorn.
line_2: But now no more soft smiles your face adorn,

line_1: Suppliant in tears I urge my suit again,
line_2: Sullen you stand, and view me with disdain;

line_1: Sullen you stand, and view me with disdain;
line_2: Suppliant in tears I urge my suit again,

line_1: Your ears exclude the story of my smart,
line_2: Your baleful eyes dart anguish to my heart.

line_1: Your baleful eyes dart anguish to my heart.
line_2: Your ears exclude the story of my smart,

line_1: I wake — glad nature hails returning day,
line_2: And the wild songsters chaunt their mattin-lay;

line_1: And the wild songsters chaunt their mattin-lay;
line_2: I wake — glad nature hails returning day,

line_1: The sun in glory mounts the crystal sky,
line_2: And all creation is in smiles but I.

line_1: And all creation is in smiles but I.
line_2: The sun in glory mounts the crystal sky,

line_1: Then, sink in death, my senses! — for in vain
line_2: You strive to quench the phrenzy of your pain;

line_1: You strive to quench the phrenzy of your pain;
line_2: Then, sink in death, my senses! — for in vain

line_1: Break, break, fond heart! — her hate thou can'st not tame,
line_2: Then take this certain triumph o'er thy flame.

line_1: Then take this certain triumph o'er thy flame.
line_2: Break, break, fond heart! — her hate thou can'st not tame,

line_1: 'Tis done! — the dread of future wrongs is past —
line_2: Lo! brittle passion verges to its last!

line_1: Lo! brittle passion verges to its last!
line_2: 'Tis done! — the dread of future wrongs is past —

line_1: 'Tis done! — vain life's illusive scenes are o'er —
line_2: Disdainful beauty shakes her chains no more.

line_1: Disdainful beauty shakes her chains no more.
line_2: 'Tis done! — vain life's illusive scenes are o'er —

line_1: Come, peaceful gloom, expand thy downy breast,
line_2: And soothe, O soothe me to eternal rest!

line_1: And soothe, O soothe me to eternal rest!
line_2: Come, peaceful gloom, expand thy downy breast,

line_1: There hush my plaints, and gently lull my woes,
line_2: Where one still stream of dull oblivion flows.

line_1: Where one still stream of dull oblivion flows.
line_2: There hush my plaints, and gently lull my woes,

line_1: No labouring breast there heaves with torture's throws,
line_2: No heart consumes her daily hoard of woes;

line_1: No heart consumes her daily hoard of woes;
line_2: No labouring breast there heaves with torture's throws,

line_1: No dreams of former pain the soul invade,
line_2: Calmly she sleeps, a sad unthinking shade!

line_1: Calmly she sleeps, a sad unthinking shade!
line_2: No dreams of former pain the soul invade,

line_1: But e'er from thought my struggling soul is free,
line_2: One latest tear she dedicates to thee.

line_1: One latest tear she dedicates to thee.
line_2: But e'er from thought my struggling soul is free,

line_1: She views thee on the brink of vain despair,
line_2: Beat thy big breast, and rend thy flowing hair.

line_1: Beat thy big breast, and rend thy flowing hair.
line_2: She views thee on the brink of vain despair,

line_1: Feels torturing love her sable deluge roll,
line_2: Weigh down thy senses, and o'erbear thy soul.

line_1: Weigh down thy senses, and o'erbear thy soul.
line_2: Feels torturing love her sable deluge roll,

line_1: In vain your heart relents, in vain you weep,
line_2: No lover wakes from his eternal sleep.

line_1: No lover wakes from his eternal sleep.
line_2: In vain your heart relents, in vain you weep,

line_1: Alas! I see thy frantic spirit rave,
line_2: And thy last breath expiring on my grave.

line_1: And thy last breath expiring on my grave.
line_2: Alas! I see thy frantic spirit rave,

line_1: Is this the fortune of those high-priz'd charms?
line_2: Ah! spare them for some worthier lover's arms.

line_1: Ah! spare them for some worthier lover's arms.
line_2: Is this the fortune of those high-priz'd charms?

line_1: And may these bodings ne'er with truth agree,
line_2: May grief and anguish be unknown to thee,

line_1: May grief and anguish be unknown to thee,
line_2: And may these bodings ne'er with truth agree,

line_1: May bitter memory ne'er recount with pain,
line_2: That e'er you frown'd, or I admir'd in vain.

line_1: That e'er you frown'd, or I admir'd in vain.
line_2: May bitter memory ne'er recount with pain,

line_1: No more — my spirit is prepar'd to fly,
line_2: Supprest my voice, and stiffen'd is my eye:

line_1: Supprest my voice, and stiffen'd is my eye:
line_2: No more — my spirit is prepar'd to fly,

line_1: Death's swimming shadows intercept my view,
line_2: Vain world, and thou relentless nymph, adieu!

line_1: Vain world, and thou relentless nymph, adieu!
line_2: Death's swimming shadows intercept my view,

line_1: AN o'ergrown wood my wandering steps invade,
line_2: Dire haunt, for none but savage monsters made,

line_1: With surface mantled in untrodden snow;
line_2: Where frosts descend, and howling tempests blow.

line_1: Dire haunt, for none but savage monsters made,
line_2: AN o'ergrown wood my wandering steps invade,

line_1: Where frosts descend, and howling tempests blow.
line_2: With surface mantled in untrodden snow;

line_1: Here, from the search of busy mortals stray'd,
line_2: For sure, no forest boasts too deep a shade,

line_1: My woe-worn soul shall hug her galling chain:
line_2: No haunt too wild for misery to remain.

line_1: For sure, no forest boasts too deep a shade,
line_2: Here, from the search of busy mortals stray'd,

line_1: No haunt too wild for misery to remain.
line_2: My woe-worn soul shall hug her galling chain:

line_1: O my Aminta! dear distracting name!
line_2: Still writhes my soul beneath its torturing flame,

line_1: Late all my comfort, all my fond delight;
line_2: Still thy pale image fills my aching sight!

line_1: Still writhes my soul beneath its torturing flame,
line_2: O my Aminta! dear distracting name!

line_1: Still thy pale image fills my aching sight!
line_2: Late all my comfort, all my fond delight;

line_1: When shall vain memory slumber o'er her woes?
line_2: When shall this fatal form in death repose,

line_1: When to oblivion be her tale resign'd?
line_2: Like thine, fair victim, to the dust consign'd?

line_1: When shall this fatal form in death repose,
line_2: When shall vain memory slumber o'er her woes?

line_1: Like thine, fair victim, to the dust consign'd?
line_2: When to oblivion be her tale resign'd?

line_1: Again the accents faulter on my tongue;
line_2: From sharp reflection is the dagger sprung,

line_1: Again to tear the conscious tear succeeds;
line_2: And Nature, wounded to the center, bleeds.

line_1: From sharp reflection is the dagger sprung,
line_2: Again the accents faulter on my tongue;

line_1: And Nature, wounded to the center, bleeds.
line_2: Again to tear the conscious tear succeeds;

line_1: Ye bitter skies! upon the tale descend —
line_2: Around, ye gentler oaks, your branches bend,

line_1: Ye blasts! tho' rude your visits, lend an ear —
line_2: And, as ye listen, drop an icy tear.

line_1: Around, ye gentler oaks, your branches bend,
line_2: Ye bitter skies! upon the tale descend —

line_1: And, as ye listen, drop an icy tear.
line_2: Ye blasts! tho' rude your visits, lend an ear —

line_1: 'Twas when the step with conscious pleasure roves,
line_2: When Flora wantons o'er th' enamell'd groves,

line_1: Where round the shades the circling woodbines throng;
line_2: And feather'd choirs indulge the amorous song.

line_1: When Flora wantons o'er th' enamell'd groves,
line_2: 'Twas when the step with conscious pleasure roves,

line_1: And feather'd choirs indulge the amorous song.
line_2: Where round the shades the circling woodbines throng;

line_1: Inspir'd by duteous love, I fondly stray'd,
line_2: Beneath a silent thicket as they play'd,

line_1: Two milk-white doves officious to ensnare:
line_2: A grateful present for my softer fair.

line_1: Beneath a silent thicket as they play'd,
line_2: Inspir'd by duteous love, I fondly stray'd,

line_2: Two milk-white doves officious to ensnare:

line_1: But ah! in smiles no more they met my sight,
line_2: Where (my dire emblem) a rapacious Kite

line_1: Their ruffled heads lay gasping on the ground:
line_2: Tore their soft limbs, and strew'd their plumes around.

line_2: But ah! in smiles no more they met my sight,

line_2: Their ruffled heads lay gasping on the ground:

line_1: The tear of pity stole into my eye;
line_2: Forbid the victims unreveng'd to die,

line_1: While ruder passions in their turn succeed;
line_2: And doom the author of their wrongs to bleed.

line_1: Forbid the victims unreveng'd to die,
line_2: The tear of pity stole into my eye;

line_1: And doom the author of their wrongs to bleed.
line_2: While ruder passions in their turn succeed;

line_1: With hasty step, enrag'd, I homewards ran,
line_2: That fatal hour my date of woe began,

line_1: (Curse on my speed!) th' unerring tube I brought:
line_2: Too sharp to tell — too horrible for thought —

line_1: That fatal hour my date of woe began,
line_2: With hasty step, enrag'd, I homewards ran,

line_1: Too sharp to tell — too horrible for thought —
line_2: (Curse on my speed!) th' unerring tube I brought:

line_1: Disastrous deed! — irrevocable ill! —
line_2: Teach me, remorseless monsters, not to feel,

line_1: How shall I tell the anguish of my Fate!
line_2: Instruct me, fiends and furies, to relate!

line_1: Teach me, remorseless monsters, not to feel,
line_2: Disastrous deed! — irrevocable ill! —

line_1: Instruct me, fiends and furies, to relate!
line_2: How shall I tell the anguish of my Fate!

line_1: Wrathful behind the guilty shade I stole,
line_2: Too late I saw the idol of my soul,

line_1: I rais'd the tube — the clamorous woods resound —
line_2: Struck by my aim, fall shrieking to the ground!

line_2: Wrathful behind the guilty shade I stole,

line_1: Struck by my aim, fall shrieking to the ground!

line_1: No other bliss her soul allow'd but me;
line_2: She sought concealment from a shady tree,

line_1: (Hapless the pair that thus indulgent prove)
line_2: In amorous silence to observe her love.

line_2: No other bliss her soul allow'd but me;

line_1: I ran — but O! too soon I found it true! —
line_2: From her wan eyes the sparkling lustres flew —

line_1: From her stain'd breast life's crimson stream'd apace —
line_2: The short-liv'd roses faded from her face!

line_1: From her wan eyes the sparkling lustres flew —
line_2: I ran — but O! too soon I found it true! —

line_1: The short-liv'd roses faded from her face!
line_2: From her stain'd breast life's crimson stream'd apace —

line_1: Gods! — could I bear that fond reproachful look,
line_2: But partial death awhile her tongue forsook,

line_1: That strove her peerless innocence to plead! —
line_2: To save a wretch that doom'd himself to bleed.

line_1: But partial death awhile her tongue forsook,
line_2: Gods! — could I bear that fond reproachful look,

line_1: To save a wretch that doom'd himself to bleed.

line_1: While I distracted press'd her in my arms,
line_2: "O spare, rash love, she cry'd, thy fatal charms,

line_1: And fondly strove t' imbibe her latest breath;
line_2: " Nor seek cold shelter in the arms of death.

line_1: "O spare, rash love, she cry'd, thy fatal charms,

line_2: "Then urge not thy distress when low I lie,

line_2: With sable yew the rising turf I grac'd,

line_2: And bade the cypress mourn in silence near.

line_2: Thro' sleepless night my haunted spirit mourns,
